questionListItems.title: Can parents/guardians meet teachers or School Leaders?

answer.body: Parents/guardians should call the General Office to make an appointment to meet with teachers, Year Heads, and School Leaders.

questionListItems.title: How do parents/guardians communicate with teachers?

answer.body: Parents/guardians can write a note in the Student Handbook, send an email to the teachers, call the office and leave a note for the teacher to return the call etc. Parents/guardians may wish to check with teachers on their preferred modes of communication (e.g. Class Dojo, etc.).

• Monday, Tuesday, Thursday and Friday: 7.30 am to 1.30 pm

  • Wednesday: 7.30 am to 1.15 pm

questionListItems.title: What happens when parents/guardians are late for pick up?

answer.body: Parents/guardians should call the General Office to alert the school. After the school gates are closed, students will be brought to the General Office and parents/guardians will be called.

questionListItems.title: Where can parents/guardians wait for students after school?

answer.body:
Parents/guardians can wait at Gate 8 (back gate) and Gate 1 (canteen gate). These gates are open for dismissal at the following times:

  • Monday, Tuesday, Thursday and Friday 1.30 to 2.00 pm

  • Wednesday: 1.15 to 1.45 pm

questionListItems.title: Is there a Student Care Centre (SCC) in the school? How do parents/guardians apply for SCC?

answer.body: Yes, there is a Student Care Centre (SCC) in the school that provides after-school care. Parents/guardians of students who have successfully secured a place in the school will be invited to apply.

topics.title: Services: Student Care Centre & School Bus

questionListItems.title: I wish to contact the bookshop / uniform supplier / school bus vendor? Where can I get their contact information?

answer.body: You may look for their contact information in the ‚"Facilities & Services", tab under ‚"Information", or click here

topics.title: Services: Student Care Centre & School Bus

questionListItems.title: Is there a school bus service? How do parents/guardians apply for the school bus service?

answer.body: Yes. Parents/guardians of students who have successfully secured a place in the school will be invited to apply.

topics.title: Services: Student Care Centre & School Bus

questionListItems.title: What are the niche areas for QtPS?

answer.body: QtPS has niches in Visual Arts through our Learning for Life Programme (LLP), as well as in Environmental Project-Based Learning, through our Applied Learning Programme (ALP).

questionListItems.title: Are students expected to carry a heavy bag to school daily?

answer.body: School bags must be manageable as students will be required to move between different classrooms and levels for various lessons. To manage the load, some books are kept in school by teachers or in the students' individual lockers. Students are advised to pack their books and learning materials according to the timetable and avoid adding unnecessary weight to their bags

topics.title: Daily Concerns: School Bag, Recess, Etc

questionListItems.title: Is there Halal food sold in the canteen?

answer.body: Stalls 5, 6 and 7 are Halal Certified by MUIS and sell Halal food only. Stall 8 sells Halal steamed buns.

topics.title: Daily Concerns: School Bag, Recess, Etc

questionListItems.title: What should students bring for recess? How much money should they bring?

answer.body:
Students should bring plain water in water bottles, refillable at water coolers around the school. Students may bring their own food in lunch boxes or purchase food from the canteen. Water bottles and lunch boxes must be clearly labeled with the student's name and class.

If a student is buying food and drink from the canteen, a good amount to bring is $2.00 to $2.60 in cash/ePayment. Set meals range from $1.80 to $2.00. Drinks range from $0.80 to $1.20. For students who prefer to go cashless, POSB Smart Buddy watches may be used.

Application details will be provided before P1 Admin Day. Students under MOE FASor School-Based Financial Assistance Schemes will have the money credited to them in their Ez-Link cards upon activation for them to purchase their meals.

It would be good to teach your child how to count money in preparation for school. Do give your child smaller denominations, like 50-cent coins or $1 coins, as these are easier for them to handle. Please avoid $5 or $10 notes.

topics.title: Daily Concerns: School Bag, Recess, Etc

questionListItems.title: What times do Primary 1s have their breaks?

answer.body:
• Recess Time: 9.00am to 9.30am (30 mins) in the canteen.

  • Elevenses (snack break): 12.15pm to 12.30pm (15 mins) in the classroom.

Parents/guardians should pack light, healthy snacks that can be easily eaten in the classroom.

topics.title: Daily Concerns: School Bag, Recess, Etc
